name: Calculus I
description: This course provides an introduction to the fundamental concepts of calculus, including limits, derivatives, and integrals.

name: Calculus II
description: This course builds on the fundamental concepts of calculus introduced in Calculus I and introduces students to more advanced concepts and techniques, such as integrals over regions, polar coordinates, and infinite series.

name: Physics I
description: This course provides an introduction to classical mechanics, including topics such as kinematics, forces, energy, and momentum.

name: Physics II
description: This course builds on the topics covered in Physics I and covers more advanced topics such as electromagnetism, optics, and thermodynamics.

name: Statics
description: This course provides an introduction to the principles of static equilibrium and the analysis of simple structures.

name: Materials Science
description: This course provides an introduction to the basic principles of materials science, including topics such as crystal structure, defects, and mechanical properties.

name: Strength of Materials
description: This course covers the design of structural elements, including stresses, strains, and beam deflections.

name: Dynamics
description: This course provides an introduction to the principles of dynamics and the analysis of particle and rigid body motion.

name: Thermodynamics
description: This course covers the basic principles of thermodynamics, including topics such as heat transfer, work, and energy conversion.

name: Structural Analysis
description: This course covers the analysis of statically determinate and indeterminate structures.

name: Fluid Mechanics
description: This course provides an introduction to the principles of fluid mechanics, including topics such as fluid statics, fluid dynamics, and flow measurement.

name: Geotechnical Engineering
description: This course covers the properties and mechanics of soils and rocks, including topics such as soil composition, soil testing, and foundation design.

name: Transportation Engineering
description: This course covers the design and analysis of transportation systems, including topics such as traffic flow theory, geometric design, and pavement design.

name: Structural Design
description: This course covers the design of simple structural systems, including topics such as architectural considerations, load calculations, and structural detailing.

name: Environmental Engineering
description: This course provides an introduction to the principles of environmental engineering, including topics such as water quality, air pollution, and solid waste management.

name: Building Systems Engineering
description: This course covers the design of mechanical, electrical, and plumbing systems for buildings, including topics such as heating and cooling systems, lighting systems, and fire protection.

name: Architectural Engineering Design
description: This course provides students with the opportunity to apply the principles learned in previous courses to the design of an architectural engineering project.
